title: Tool Details
description: Information about a tool onboarded to FIT

active_development.description: If the source code is actively developed

tool_name.description: The full name of the tool

authors.description: All authors of the tool who have made significant contributions

contributors.description: Those who have contributed small changes to the tool

tool_logo.description: URL to an image of the tool's logo

noaa_internal.description: Was this developed in part by NOAA employees or affiliates?

maintainer_name.description: Name of the primary maintainer. One name only.

maintainer_email.description: Email address of the maintainer. One email only.

background_text.description: A paragraph of background text that describes the tool.

citation.description: Primary way to cite the tool

references.description: References related to the tool, not the citation

associated_tools.description: Other software tools related to this one. Can be part of FIT or not.

user_organizations.description: Any organizations that use the tool operationally

online_app_link.description: link to the web app for the tool, if available

executable_link.description: link to the executable(s) for the tool, if available

website_link.description: link to the website for the tool, if available

documentation_link.description: link to the documentation for the tool, if available and different than other links provided

source_code_link.description: Link to the source code, if available.

pdf_download_link.description: Link to a pdf to download from the FIT tool page. Should be different than other links provided if used.

software_badges.description: Link to up to 3 software badges (e.g., from github actions, shields.io) to display for the tool

alt_text.description: alt text description of the badge

installation_instructions.description: Short instructions on how to install the tool

toolbox_drawers.description: The toolbox drawers that the tool belongs in. Choose all that apply.

keywords.description: Keywords for the tool. Choose up to 5.

uses_github_releases.description: Does the tool use github releases? If so, the current version number will be pulled from the releases.

static_version_number.description: Static version number, only used if the tool is unlikely to be updated often.

release_badge.description: The github org/repo if using the release badge. Plan to deprecate this and info from source_code_link and use_github_releases instead
